NamedNodeMap.summary: The NamedNodeMap interface represents a collection of objects. Objects inside a NamedNodeMap are not in any particular order, unlike , although they may be accessed by an index as in an array.

remarks.para: A NamedNodeMap object is live and will thus be auto-updated if changes are made to its contents internally or elsewhere.

blockquote.para: Although called NamedNodeMap, this interface doesn't deal with objects but with objects, which are a specialized class of objects.

NamedNodeMapGetNamedItem.summary: The getNamedItem() method of the interface returns the corresponding to the given name, or null if there is no corresponding attribute.

blockquote.para:
This method is also called when you use the operator [] syntax.
So, myMap[str] is equivalent to myMap.getNamedItem(str) where str is a string.

NamedNodeMapGetNamedItem.returns: An corresponding to the name given in parameter, or null if none has been found.

NamedNodeMapGetNamedItemNS.summary: The getNamedItemNS() method of the interface returns the corresponding to the given local name in the given namespace, or null if there is no corresponding attribute.
NamedNodeMapGetNamedItemNS.returns: An corresponding to the namespace and local name given in parameters, or null if none has been found.

NamedNodeMapItem.summary:
The item() method of the interface
returns the item in the map matching the index.

blockquote.para:
This method is also called when you use the operator [] syntax.
So, myMap[i] is equivalent to myMap.item(i) where i is a number.

NamedNodeMapItem.returns:
An or null if the number is greater than or equal to the length of
the map.

NamedNodeMapLength.summary:
The read-only length property of the interface
is the number of objects stored in the map.
NamedNodeMapLength.value: A number containing the number of objects in the map

NamedNodeMapRemoveNamedItem.summary:
The removeNamedItem() method of the interface
removes the corresponding to the given name from the map.

NamedNodeMapRemoveNamedItemNS.summary:
The removeNamedItemNS() method of the interface
removes the corresponding to the given namespace and local name from the map.

NamedNodeMapSetNamedItem.summary:
The setNamedItem() method of the interface
puts the identified by its name in the map.
If there is already an with the same name in the map,
it is replaced.
NamedNodeMapSetNamedItem.returns: Returns the old attribute if replaced, or null if the attribute is new.

NamedNodeMapSetNamedItemNS.summary:
The setNamedItemNS() method of the interface
puts the identified by its name in the map.
If there was already an with the same name in the map,
it is replaced.

blockquote.para:
This method is an alias of setNamedItem() you can use them
interchangeably.

NamedNodeMapSetNamedItemNS.returns: Returns the old attribute if replaced, or null if the attribute is new.
